title: Social Worker Interview

title: Research Assistant Interview

Interview Questions: Why I am a good fit for the role

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at IMH
Interview Descriptions: Nothing much, asked if i knew chinese and i said yes, asked how my math was and whether id be willing to do fieldwork. if you say yes for them all then you should be fine
Interview Questions: how is your chinese speaking skills

title: Executive Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at IMH
Interview Descriptions: Submitted CV online, heard back from HR within a week. Interview lasted for about 30mins, followed by a writing test. The interviewers seemed to lack experience and empathy; asked unnecessary questions not related to the job and showed a lack of interest. Wasted my time.
Interview Questions: I googled your address but can’t find it on google maps. Where is your house located ah?

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at IMH
Interview Descriptions: Interviewers were nice and friendly. Asked about work experience and how to respond to certain hypothetical situations, such as handling difficult patients, managing caseload and managing stress level and others.
Interview Questions: What is one challenge you forsee to have in the job

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at IMH (Singapore) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: For them to get to know you and asking questions to ensure that expectations are on the same page. Questions involve introducing yourself, them explaining the various projects that is made available, and them asking you questions about your skillsets and current willingness to adapt to the project given the nature of the target audience.
Interview Questions: Their questions were based on the introduction that I provided to ensure that I had the same expectations as them.

title: Executive Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at IMH
Interview Descriptions: No information on the job description throughout the interview, got very vague answers. They asked what I thought the role was about, to which I answered but was not given an explanation of what the role actually encompasses after that. Kept asking/insinuated if I was applying for the correct role because this is not the route to becoming a clinical psychologist. After confirming several times, the interviewer asked what my friends who had the same degree as me were currently working as, which is completely irrelevant to my job interview - after which the interviewer routed it back to the topic of a clinical psychologist route again.  Overall, unfriendly and unpleasant. Worst job interview in my life.
Interview Questions:
Introduce yourself, your current role & why you applied for this role.

Do you OT a lot? Are you expected to OT a lot in your current job?

title: Associate Psych Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at IMH
Interview Descriptions: There were multiple interviewers. Be prepared for a difficult role-play. Certain interviewers were harsh and judgemental. They held a condescending tone expecting a masters for this non-masters position. Interested in the role but declined offer after the interview as I felt management may not be so welcoming.
Interview Questions: What are some of your strengths?

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at IMH
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quite okay, i just got asked the general questions about my research background and what field I am interested in. The interviewer was quite chill, and wasn't intimidating.
Interview Questions: What research skills do you possess that would make you useful for this internship?

title: Executive Interview

Before the interview, there was a written short essay test. 

Panel interview with 3-4 interviewers. They were friendly and engaging - a lot of personal questions/ motivations were asked. Overall, a pleasant interview experience

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at IMH (Singapore) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: They would call you up for an interview around 3 weeks after your application if successful. It was a panel interview and they asked basic questions - mainly about your CV, why you want the internship etc.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this internship?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at IMH (Singapore) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview lasting around 30 minutes asking about your aspirations, future goals, past experiences and how they may apply to the internship. After which, you would receive a reply on whether you’re accepted or rejected within 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for the internship?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at IMH (Singapore) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Zoom call, few questions about academics, experience and long-term goals. The interviewer reviewed my university transcript and assessed my interest in the job. Expressing intention to stay on long-term is good.
Interview Questions: What are your future plans?

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at IMH (Singapore) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Quick response from HR regarding application procedure and interview dates via email.
Interviewers were friendly and encouraging.
During contract signing explanation of contract was fast and not too clear. Will be hard to grasp especially if first time signing contract. Allowances not clearly explained. Do note that NHG staff in IMH do not have ward allowance but have hazardous and shift allowance. However in singhealth ward allowances is offered at a higher rate ontop of shift allowance. 
Healthcheck ups and follow ups went smoothly with good flow of communication.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself 
What speciality are you interested in
Case scenario of an angry patient. What will you do?
Internship experience

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at IMH
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward. One round of interview with simple questions on past experience and interests. No tricky questions involved and HR staff was nice. Got a follow up call from HR around a week later and was told to sign the contract. HR explained the contract details very well
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

Interview with HR manager and dept head . We talked about an hour . Dept head shared about the dept 
This was followed by a  written test to assess knowledge/ competency
Interview Questions:
Tell me about your last job 
What questions do high have

title: Patient Therapy Associate (Adult Neurodevelopmental Services) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at IMH (Singapore) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Overall interview process was a breeze. Its easy to locate the HR office, which is at the 2nd floor. Its very near to the front lobby, just find the staircase behind the atm machines. 

HR personnel will check all your relevant documents(education certs/NS testimonial & cert) and application form. Be sure to bring the original certs and a set of photocopy ones.

You will proceed to a different room for the interview. In my case, 3 staff was present through out my interview but only 2 of them asked me questions pertaining to my past work experience, the other staff was the HR personnel.

Interviewer was friendly, no vibe of cocky-ness or whatsoever.
Interview Questions: How comfortable are you, to be working with people with Intellectual disabilty? (Autism/Developmental delay)

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at IMH in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Relatively smooth and easy interview. Interviewers were friendly and passionate about research in mental health in Singapore. Working environment seems nice and quiet but hard to get there (quite isolated from city).
Interview Questions: What are your research interest?

title: Executive Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at IMH (Singapore) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: hiring process was done online via a job site application. a week later i got call up for an interview. It was a single session panel interview. upon arrival for the interview there is a written test to be taken before the interview.
Interview Questions: What are your career goals | tell me more about yourself | tell me 3 things about you

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at IMH (Singapore) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied through my school. Submitted my resume and cover letter. Got called up a few weeks later for an interview. I was waitlisted, but I got accepted in the end (I only found out I was waitlisted when I was in the company)
Interview Questions: How good are you with SPSS?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at IMH (Singapore) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: The whole process took less than 4 weeks.  i was called up for interview. The department director, senior social worker and HR Personnel were present. The director was trying to assess my suitability for the job with lots of typical interview questions. Her questions were straightforward and lots of personal questions as well.
Interview Questions: who do you want to work in IMH?

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at IMH (Singapore) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Interview was quite straightforward.
Started off with filling up some scenario questions on a paper - included questions like how will you handle a difficult parent at the clinic? 
Then proceeded to a 20-minute interview with 2 interviewers( a research and assistant psychologist in the team), starting with open ended questions questions like describing yourself, past related experiences etc. Interviewers were quite nice, no trick questions etc.
Interview Questions: How will you handle a conflict with a colleague in the same team?
